title: Gray Days and Gold ... New edition, revised, with illustrations
author: Winter, William
snippet: Close by Cockburnspath is thelong, lonely, melancholy beach that well may have beenin Scott's remembrance when he fashioned that weirdand tragic close of the most poetical and pathetic of hisnovels, while, near at hand, on its desolate headland,the grim ruin of Fast Castle,—which is deemed theoriginal of his Wolf's Crag, — frowns darkly on thewhite breakers at its surge-beaten base.
